ORDER ONLINE
OR CALL (609) 846-1110
a wildwood favorite
since 2015
“
... a unique, fresh, made-to-order menu that is very reasonably priced.
”
— Press of Atlantic City
For Galleries
For Albums
For Pages
Located in the heart of Wildwood,  Old City Pub offers guests a unique menu prepared in a from-scratch kitchen.
The building dates back to 1913, when it was the Wildwood Title & Trust Company.  It later became Cape Savings and Loan Bank.  This was one of Wildwood’s first financial institutions, and rumor has it the bank funded the island’s very first developers.  The old vaults are still intact and have since been converted into refrigeration units used to store kegs and bottled beer.
View fullsize
3301 Atlantic Avenue has housed several businesses over the years.  It was first converted from a bank into a bar in 2001 as Tucker’s Pub.  After a change in ownership and extensive renovations, Old City Pub officially opened its doors in 2015.  The pub has been praised for its excellent staff in a 2015 article for the Press of Atlantic City.   A local favorite, OCP continues to serve patrons the island’s best food and drinks.
View fullsize

(609) 846-1110
